pullRequest.title: Add catalog name and deserializer class name to split information
pullRequest.bodyText:
with these changes, splitinfo emitted through the splitcompletedevent payload changes to the following. The changes are useful for classifying splits corresponding to different connectors and tracking file format usage.
      "info": {
        "@type": "splitOperator",
        "catalogName": "hive2",
        "splitInfo": {
          "path": "....",
          "start": 0,
          "length": 321,
          "estimatedFileSize": 321,
          "hosts": ["....","....", ..... ],
          "database": "test_db",
          "table": "test_table",
          "forceLocalScheduling": false,
          "partitionName": "<UNPARTITIONED>",
          "deserializerClassName": "org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.orc.OrcSerde",
          "s3SelectPushdownEnabled": false
        }
      }

The catalog is also stored at top level in SplitCompletedEvent.

nodes.bodyText: I think some connectors return null when we invoke getInfo
This should be a field in SplitCompletedEvent, instead.

commit.message:
Add deserializer class name to HiveSplit#getInfo

This value is useful for tracking the file format of hive splits scanned.

Add catalog name to SplitCompletedEvent

The catalog name is useful for attributing scanned splits
to the respective catalogs.

afterCommit.message:
Add catalog name to SplitCompletedEvent

The catalog name is useful for attributing scanned splits
to the respective catalogs.
